rationale: Electrical, Electronic, Instrumentation and allied engineering diploma holders are required to use and maintain various types of electronically controlled equipment. The fundamental principles of electronics are to be applied in most of the situations to arrive at the probable solutions which is faced in the world of work, therefore the knowledge of the functions of various basic electronic devices and components and practical skills acquired through the laboratory experiments will help them, when they work with electronic equipment and its sub-circuits. This course is designed to develop the skills to use the basics electronic components and apply the knowledge to maintain the various types of electronic circuits.
competency: To maintain various electronics circuits and implement related applications.

courseOutcomes.description: Compare different biasing techniques of Transistors.
Analyze Frequency Response of Transistor Amplifier.
Determine performance parameters for transistorized amplifier using H parameter
Test different electronic circuits consisting of diodes and transistors.
Develop Regulated Power Supply for Green Technology.

underpinningTheory.unitTitle: Transistor Biasing circuits And Thermal stability

unitOutcomes.description: Explain biasing of amplifier and operating point
Describe the D.C. and A.C. Load Lines
Compare Biasing Methods
Explain Stability Factor with features
Explain compensation techniques for bias stability
Describe Thermal Runaway and Thermal Stability
Select appropriate Heat Sink

topics.title: Biasing of Amplifier and Definition of Operating Point
The Load Lines
subtopics: D.C. Load Line and A.C. Load Line

topics.title: Biasing Methods
Stability Factor
Compensation techniques for bias stability
Thermal Runaway, Thermal Resistance & Thermal Stability
Heat Sink and its types

unitOutcomes.description: Define Amplifier Parameters
Describe effect of Bypass and Coupling Capacitor on Frequency Response
Explain Single Stage Amplifier
Compare Coupling Techniques for cascading
Explain Frequency Response Two Stage RC Coupled Amplifier

topics.title: Gain, Bandwidth and Gain Bandwidth product
Effect of Emitter Bypass Capacitor and Coupling Capacitor on frequency response
Frequency Response of Single Stage Amplifier
Different Coupling Techniques for cascading
Frequency Response of Two Stage RC Coupled amplifiers

unitOutcomes.description: Describe the h – parameters of two-port network
Explain h – parameters for Transistor amplifier
Analysis of h – parameters for Transistor amplifier

topics.title: Two port network, h – parameters and its equivalent circuits
h - Parameters for Transistor amplifier
Transistor Amplifier parameters- Av, Ai, Ap, Ro, Ri using h- parameters (No Derivations)

unitOutcomes.description: Determine the output of clipper, clamper and voltage multiplier circuits
Explain application of different diodes
Use transistors in different applications
Describe Darlington pair and relay driver with its applications

topics.title: Different types of Clipper Clamper circuits, Voltage Multiplier circuits
Seven Segment Display, Infrared (IR) LED, OLED, AMOLED, Freewheeling (fly back) diode, switching diode, opto-coupler
Transistor used as a Tuned Amplifier
Darlington Pair and its applications
A relay driver circuit using transistors and ICs(TIP122, ULN2003, ULN 2803)

unitOutcomes.description: Explain working of Regulated Power Supply
Explain different types of Fixed and variable voltage regulators
Describe SMPS applications
Explain UPS
Explain working of solar battery charger circuits

topics.title: Regulated power supply
Shunt voltage regulator
Transistorized series voltage regulator (basic and with feedback, without derivation)
Three Terminal Fixed/ variable voltage regulator
Switch mode power supply(SMPS)
Uninterruptible power supply (UPS)
Solar battery charger circuits

practicalExercises.description: Build and test voltage divider biased type amplifier and measure voltage at different points on the circuit and observe waveforms
Test thermal stability of fixed biased type amplifier.
Obtain frequency response of single stage transistor amplifier.
Obtain frequency response of two stage RC-coupled amplifier.
Build and test different types of clipper circuits.
Build and test different types of clamper circuits.
Display numbers using 7 segment LED. (Common Anode and Common Cathode- Both)
Build amplifier using Darlington pair and calculate its gain.
Build voltage regulator using 78xx and 79xx and measure the dropout voltage for the given voltage regulator.
Build variable voltage regulator using LM317 and measure the dropout voltage for the given voltage regulator.
Build and test one micro project using basic electronic components and general purpose PCB.

specificationTable.unitTitle: Transistor biasing circuits and Thermal stability

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Dual variable DC power supply, 0- 30V, 2A, With Short circuit protection, separate display for voltage and current
Cathode Ray Oscilloscope, Dual Trace 20 MHz, 1MΩ Input Impedance
Function Generator 0-2 MHz with Sine, square and triangular output with variable frequency and amplitude
Digital Multimeter: 3 1/2 digit display, 1999 count digital multimeter measures: Vac, Vdc (600V max), Adc, Aac (10 amp max), Resistance (0 - 2 MΩ), with diode and transistor tester

Electronic Workbench: Bread Board 840 -1000 contact points: Positive and Negative DC power rails on opposite sides of the board with, 0-30 V, 2 Amp Variable DC power supply, Function Generator 0-2MHz, CRO 0-30MHz, Digital Multimeter

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member
Practice environment friendly methods and processes
studentActivities: Prepare a table and interpret the technical specification of various diodes and transistors using data sheet
Compare specifications of various voltage regulator ICs
Prepare a survey report of different heat sinks used in electronic devices/instruments and list out the alternatives used for heat sinks
Undertake a market survey of Different types of Amplifiers
Prepare labeled chart of SMPS and UPS
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students to find different ICs used in real time application based on diodes and transistors

microProjects.title: Transistor Amplifier: a common emitter amplifier using transistor and prepare a mini project report
Transistors Application: Build any application based on transistor and prepare a mini project report
Diodes Application: Build basic applications using any one or combination of diodes, and prepare a mini project report
Opto devices: Build an automatic power saving street light controller circuit using opto devices and prepare a mini project report
Battery Chargers: Build a mobile/USB battery charger using solar cell
